title: ‘Mother was tied up by killer then forced to have sex with her 11 year-old son’
text:
Convicted murderer Jerry Gilligan, left, will stand trial at Mohave County Superior Court, right, in a fortnight over claims he tortured a female relative and made the woman have sex with her 11 year old son (Pictures: Mohave County Sheriff’s Office/Google Maps)

A convicted murderer poured acid on a female relative before making her have sex with her 11 year-old son while he filmed them, police say.

Torture suspect Jerry Gilligan, 72, will stand trial in a fortnight for the horrific catalog of abuse, suspected to have taken place in Kingman, Arizona, during September 2016.

The wheelchair-bound defendant is said to have sluiced battery acid into the woman’s eyes after tying her and her young son up, and taping their mouths’ shut.

He beat them with a wooden stick, taped their hands and feet together, then shaved their heads during a four day orgy of violence, prosecutors allege.

Gilligan, who burnt and beat his stepdad to death in 1980, is also said to have made them perform sex acts on him, then each other, while he took photos and recorded videos.

The mother and son’s ordeal came to an end after the woman was taken to hospital suffering horrific injuries, and told doctors there what had happened to her.

Boy, 2, nearly died after being savaged by venomous snake

Police found evidence at Gilligan’s home that substantiated her claims, and say they believe the woman and her son to have suffered at the killer’s hands for two years.

That evidence Gilligan arrested and charged with multiple counts including sexual conduct with a minor under 12, aggravated assault by domestic violence, sexual exploitation of a minor and kidnapping.

He completed a 25 year prison sentence for stepdad Walter Bopp’s murder in October 2014, suggesting Gilligan began abusing his latest victims as soon as he was freed.

Their relationship to Gilligan has not been outlined to protect their privacy.

Prosecutor Jacob Cote and defense attorney Sandra Carr announced Monday that they are now ready to put Gilligan on trial, the Mohave Daily News reported.

He will appear before jurors at Mohave County Superior Court on October 29, with proceedings set to last around three or four days.

Gilligan is being held in jail without bond.
description: Jerry Gilligan allegedly tortured the woman and her son in Kingman, Arizona, after being released from jail for murdering his stepdad
